newsitem.title: SWEDEN: A quarter of Sweden Soc Dems don't want EMU-poll.
newsitem.headline: A quarter of Sweden Soc Dems don't want EMU-poll.

text.p: One-quarter of supporters of Sweden's ruling Social Democrats want the party to recommend that Sweden stay outside Europe's economic and monetary union (EMU), a poll published on Friday showed.

The poll, conducted by pollster SIFO and commissioned by brokerage Aragon Fondkommission AB, showed that 35 percent of Social Democrat voters would like the government to wait before making a decision.
Some 12 percent of the 417 surveyed said Sweden should join EMU at its scheduled start in 1999 and three percent said Sweden should choose a date after 1999 when the country should join.
Another 13 percent said Sweden should join sometime after 1999 but should not set a date about when this should happen while another 12 percent said they did not know.
